arts.ttl: Stevenage hold Reading to draw as impressive unbeaten run stretches to 10 matches
arts.sum: Stevenage, with nothing to play for marooned in midtable, certainly did not play like it and should have led following an impressive first-half performance. Clever in breaking up the play to make the spectacle poor for the viewer, when the ball was on the floor and in play it was all Boro from the off. Despite generally being second best, Reading had the first chance inside 20 minutes as the ball was worked from left to right and resulted in Chem Campbell flashing a cross at Murphy Cooper’s near post, forcing a Royal corner. Brandon Hanlan should have put the visitors ahead five minutes later, set free on the right and clear on goal but the Wycombe Wanderers loanee could only thrash his effort wide as Tyler Bindon closed him down from behind. Just on the other side of the half-hour mark, Dan Kemp had the best effort as he was found free in the box and while the top scorer caught his volley well, it was direct straight at Joel Pereira who made a good save. Lewis Wing, fresh from scoring on Tuesday, could have had his second in as many games as Jayden Wareham laid the ball back on the edge of the box but firing wide.

arts.ttl: 'Two points dropped': Reading boss on 'frustrating' Stevenage and 'stonewall' penalty
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt has labelled Saturday afternoon's 1-1 draw with Stevenage 'two points dropped.' Carl Piergianni scored in both nets during the second half as mid-table Boro frustrated the hosts. Now unbeaten in 10 matches, the Royals are two points outside the play-offs heading into the international break, with nine matches left to play. "It was a frustrating one from our point of view. They came here to slow the game down and we gave them too many, at times. We gave them the reason to put it in the box. We fouled a bit too much; we got a little frustrated with the game. "We didn’t get into a rhythm, the game we stop-start throughout. Everything took an age to do and they probably go away happy with the point. The boys are putting in a shift and we can never fault that. On the day we lacked the composure in the final third."

arts.ttl: One that got away for Stevenage but still huge positives still in draw at Reading
arts.sum: And after Reid had fired straight at the keeper, Pereira then pulling off a good reaction save to deny Eli King, a Kemp cross from right on the byline out on the left found Piergianni still up after a corner. Roberts fired wide, Reid had an effort stopped at the foot of his near post while Jake Young almost wriggled in but his shot was blocked.

arts.ttl: Reading extend unbeaten run after uninspiring draw with Stevenage
arts.sum: Boro skipper Carl Piergianni scored at both ends.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading look to extend unbeaten run to 10 with Stevenage visit
arts.sum: Reading are looking to extend their League One unbeaten run to 10 as Stevenage visit Berkshire. If results go their way, the Royals could end the day in the play-offs as Bolton Wanderers host Stockport County.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Andy Yiadom makes first start for 11 months in Stevenage clash
arts.sum: Reading captain Andy Yiadom is making his first start since April 2024 this afternoon for the visit of Stevenage. Michael Stickland received a controversial sending off in Tuesday's win over Wrexham and due to an injury crisis at the back, Yiadom is likely being brought in to play at centre-back. Noel Hunt names an unchanged team from the victory in midweek, knowing a win could put the Royals into the play-offs should results go their way elsewhere.

arts.ttl: Stevenage want a strong end to year ahead of next season
arts.sum: The boss said: "Last summer was obviously different because we had a change and even though you feel you've got a lot of time [in April], there's already players talking about next year. "To finish strongly would make sure people look at us in the right way and that we absolutely get the best players that we can.

arts.ttl: Reading midfield is 'above the level' says Stevenage boss ahead of meeting
arts.sum: Stevenage boss Alex Revell has picked out Reading's midfield ahead of tomorrow's meeting, describing them as 'above the level.' Boro sit 13th and are in no danger of relegation or promotion, narrowly losing 2-1 at Birmingham City on Tuesday. Meanwhile, the Royals are unbeaten in nine matches and sit just two points outside the play-offs after Tuesday's 2-0 win over Wrexham. A final match in a hectic run before the international break, 10 League One matches remain over the coming month. Stevenage held the Royals to a 1-1 draw in November, before Ruben Selles departed to join Hull City and was replaced by club legend Noel Hunt.

Just when Reading were beginning to look like they may fall away in the playoff race, they pulled off a monumental victory against Wrexham to move right back into contention. The Royals are just two ...

arts.ttl: Reading teenager earns first England call-up for France and Portugal clashes
arts.sum: Reading teenager Andre Garcia has been called up to England Under-18 for the first time for this month's international fixtures. The 17-year-old has made 35 appearances for the first team this season, making his debut on the opening day at Birmingham City, and has excelled at left-back. Subject to interest from Southampton in January, the youngster stepped from the Under-18s straight into the first-team, skipping the Under-21s altogether and is among the finest teenage players in the EFL this season.
